question: Good morning.
answer: Good morning.

question: Please state your name for the record.
answer: Daniel Ocean.

question: Thank you. Mr. Ocean, the purpose of this meeting is to determine whether, if released, you are likely to break the law again. While this was your first conviction, you have been implicated, though never charged, in over a dozen other confidence schemes and frauds. What can you tell us about this?
answer: As you say, ma'am, I was never charged. My wife left me. I was upset. I got into a self-destructive pattern. She already left me once. I don't think she'll do it again just for kicks. I don't know. How much do you guys make a year? My wife's. I'm a free man. Hello, Frank.

question: As you say, ma'am, I was never charged. My wife left me. I was upset. I got into a self-destructive pattern. She already left me once. I don't think she'll do it again just for kicks. I don't know. How much do you guys make a year? My wife's. I'm a free man. Hello, Frank.
answer: I beg your pardon, sir. You must have me confused with someone else. My name is Ramon. See?

question: My mistake... Table's cold anyway.
answer: You might try the lounge at the Grand, sir. It gets busy around one.

question: Thanks.
answer: Catching up on current events?

question: Ramon?
answer: Glad to meet you. Frank Catton wouldn't get by the gaming board. You just out?

question: This afternoon.
answer: And already turning over a new leaf.

question: You seen him?
answer: Last I heard he was in L.A. Teaching movie stars how to play cards. Why? You don't have something planned already?

question: You kidding? I just became a citizen again.
answer: Jesus... It's tough now, our line of work. Everybody so serious. Too many guns, too many computers. Whadda you gonna do? Steal from ordinary people?

question: That would be criminal.
answer: So what's left? Banks? Hah. Banks got no money. It's all electronic. Only place that still takes cash is...

question: Casinos.
answer: Oh, no...

question: Oh, yes...
answer: When?

question: Hey! Hey, Rusty! Hey, I don't know if you're, uh, you know, incorporated or anything, like Rusty Ryan. And, I don't know, incorporated, but you should think about it, really, 'cause I was talking to my manager yesterday --
answer: Bernie?

question: No, not Bernie, I mean not, not that Bernie, my business manager, he's also Bernie, he was telling me that since this, what we do, could be considered research for, you know, a future gig, that I should be able to write it off as a business expense. So he suggested that it'd be better if I wrote you a check, and thereby -- Or, or we could keep it cash.
answer: Alright. Who's here?

question: Josh is here. Seth is here. David couldn't make it. He's got two weeks of reshoots on Lusitania because somebody just figured out forty percent of the budget is coming from Germany.
answer: That's a problem.

question: Barry is here.
answer: I thought they let him out to do that H.B.O. thing in Vancouver.

question: Couldn't work the dates. Oh, and he brought his girlfriend.
answer: Not the one from --

question: Uh-huh.
answer: I quit watching when Kate left Don after his accident. Good evening, guys. Let's play some cards... ... and let's play some cards.

question: A hundred bucks to me... Ah, what the hell. Pocket change. Call.
answer: Why you bet a certain way is your business. But you have to make them think you're betting for a reason. Understand?

question: Why you bet a certain way is your business. But you have to make them think you're betting for a reason. Understand?
answer: To another player:

question: Seth. You know what you have. Looking at them doesn't change them. Leave 'em where they are and make your bet.
answer: To another player:

question: You're showing. Yeah, I know she's your girlfriend, Barry, but you can't... Thank you.
answer: To another:

question: Josh. Deal to your left.
answer: A WAITRESS enters from the club, and DANCE MUSIC with her. As she distributes a fresh round:

question: Barry, you're showing again.
answer: I stole things.

question: Incan matrimonial headmasks.
answer: Gallery. Headmasks. Some.

question: Don't let him fool you, Seth. There's boatloads. If you can move the things... One card to me. ... but you can't.
answer: My fence seemed confident enough.

question: If you're dealing with cash, you don't need a fence.
answer: Some people just lack vision.

question: Probably everybody in cell block E.
answer: Well, that's all behind us now.

question: I should hope so.
answer: I raise you five hundred dollars.

question: Indeed. But be careful you don't push him too high too fast. Want to keep him on the leash. I call. All you have to do is call.
answer: What? Your girlfriend holding your purse? Contrary to what Mr. Ryan may say, Seth, I always check my cards before I make a bet. But be cafeful. I could tell from your face you're holding three of a kind or better. Five hundred to call. And two grand more.

question: Guys, you're free to do what you like. It's a lot of money. But I'm staying in. He's trying to buy his way out of his bluff. We call. Shit. Sorry, guys. I -- I was sure he was bluffing.
answer: Thanks for the game, fellas. Hey, I hate to ask this, but could you sign something for me? It's for the guys in the joint. They just love all your shows.

question: That was, that was just...
answer: Unprofessional.

question: How was the clink? You get the cookies I sent you?
answer: Why do you think I came to see you first? Ten grand. Half of it's yours.

question: You barge into my new workplace, ruin my professional reputation, least you could do is tell me you've got something better for me.
answer: I've got something better for you.

question: How's Tess? Alright. Tell me.
answer: It's tricky. No one's ever done it before. Needs planning, a large crew.

question: Guns?
answer: Not loaded ones. It has to be very precise. There's a lot of security. But the take...

question: What's the target?
answer: Eight figures each.

question: What's. The. Target.
answer: When's the last time you were in Vegas?

question: What? You wanna knock over a casino?
answer: The vault at the Bellagio.

question: If I'm reading these right -- and I think that I am -- this is probably the least accessible vault ever designed. Oops. Actually, you know what, I'm wrong. It's definitely the least accessible vault ever designed.
answer: Yep.

question: You said three casinos...
answer: These feed into the cages at both the Mirage and the M.G.M. Grand. But every dime ends up here.

question: The Bellagio, Mirage, and... These are Terry Benedict's places.
answer: Yes, they are. Think he'll mind?

question: More than somewhat. You'd need at least a dozen guys, doing a combination of cons.
answer: Like what, you think?

question: Well, off the top of my head, I'd say you're looking at a Boesky, a Jim Brown, a Miss Daisy, two Jethros, and a Leon Spinks. Oh, and the biggest Ella Fitzgerald ever. Where do you think you're gonna get the money to back this?
answer: As long as we're hitting these three casinos, we'll get our bankroll. Terry Benedict has a list of enemies.

question: But does he have enemies with loose cash and nothing to lose... Aha.
answer: Aha.

question: Reuben.
answer: So...

question: So, here's what I think
answer: Uh-huh. So what are you saying?

question: I'm saying
answer: Really? I thought it was much harder than that -- Jesus, Oscar, lower it a little, will ya? Yeah, thanks. You mind if we borrow a couple drawings for the night? Make some copies. 'Preciate it.

question: I need a reason. And don't say money. Why do this?
answer: Why not do it? Because yesterday I walked out of the joint wearing my entire wardrobe and you're colddecking TeenBeat coverboys. Because the house always wins. You play long enough, never changing stakes, the house takes you. Unless, when that special hand comes around, you bet big. And then you take the house.

question: You're been practicing that speech, haven't you?
answer: A little. Did I rush it? It felt like I rushed it.

question: Alright. Who's in?
answer: Frank C. is in. Frank C. has developed a bad case of bronchitis and is putting in for a transfer to warmer climates. What about drivers?

question: I talked to the Malloys yesterday.
answer: The Mormon twins?

question: They're both in Salt Lake City, six months off the job. I got the sense they're having trouble filling the hours.
answer: Electronics?

question: Livingston Dell. Livingston's been doing freelance surveillance work of late for the F.B.I. Mob Squad.
answer: How are his nerves?

question: Munitions.
answer: Phil Turentine.

question: Dead.
answer: No shit? On the job?

question: Sun cancer.
answer: You send flowers?

question: Dated his wife a while.
answer: Basher...

question: Isn't that right, Basher?
answer: That's right.

question: Peck, A.T.F. Let me venture a guess. A simple G4 mainliner, double-coil, backwound, quick fuse with a drag under 20 feet. That's our man. Tell me something else. Have you checked him for booby traps on his person? I mean really checked, not just for weapons... Will you go find Griggs and tell him I need to see him? Just go find him, will you? How fast can you put something together with what I passed you?
answer: Done. Thirty seconds all right?

question: From when?
answer: Now.

question: Ten seconds?
answer: Not quite. Is Danny here?

question: Around the corner.
answer: Be good working with professionals again. Okay

question: Everyone down! Get down! There's a bomb in the...
answer: So he can walk on a rope.

question: More than that.
answer: So he can juggle. We need a grease man, not an acrobat. Who else is on the list?

question: He is the list.
answer: Who else?

question: Watch. There's your grease man.
answer: We need Saul.

question: He won't come. He swore off the game a year ago.
answer: He get religion?

question: Ulcers.
answer: You can ask him.

question: I can ask.
answer: I saw you in the paddock before the second race, outside the men's room, when I placed my bet. I saw you before you even got up this morning.

question: How ya been, Saul?
answer: Never better.

question: What's with the orange?
answer: My doctor says I need vitamins.

question: So why don't you take vitamins?
answer: You come here to give me a physical?

question: I got a box seat. Come on. I thought you drank bloody Mary's at the track, Saul.
answer: A man shouldn't drink on the job.

question: Who we rooting for here?
answer: Number four. You gonna ask me? Or should I just say no and get it over with?

question: Saul, you're the best there is. You're in Cooperstown. What do you want?
answer: Nothin'. I got a duplex now, I got wall-to-wall and a goldfish, I'm seeing a nice lady, she works the unmentionables counter at Macy's. I've changed.

question: Guys like us don't change, Saul. We stay sharp or we get sloppy, but we don't change.
answer: Quit connin' me.

question: That your hound way in the back there?
answer: He breaks late. Everyone knows this. You gonna treat me like a grownup at least? Tell me what the scam is?

question: And Saul makes ten. Ten should do it, don't you think? You think we need one more? You think we need one more. Okay. We'll get one more.
answer: Sorry 'bout that.

question: Hi, Linus. Sit down.
answer: Who are you?

question: A friend of Bobby Caldwell's. Sit down. Bobby told me about you. Said you were the best set of hands he ever saw. Didn't expect to find you working wallets on the subway.
answer: That wasn't work, that was practice.

question: You're either in or out, right now.
answer: What is it?

question: A plane ticket. A job offer.
answer: You're pretty trusting pretty fast.

question: Bobby has every faith in you.
answer: Fathers are like that. He didn't tell you? He doesn't like me trading on his name.

question: You do this job, he'll be trading on yours.
answer: What if I say no?

question: We'll get someone else who won't be quite as good. You can go back to feeling up stockbrokers. That's the best lift I've seen you make yet.
answer: Las Vegas, huh?

question: Hi.
answer: You're Bobby Caldwell's kid, huh?

question: Yeah.
answer: From Chicago?

question: Yeah.
answer: It's nice there. You like it?

question: Yeah.
answer: That's wonderful. Get in the goddamn room.

question: It's a little more complicated than that.
answer: Courtesy of Frank Catton, new blackjack dealer at the Bellagio, security tapes from the three casinos. Okay. Bad news first. This place houses a security system which rivals most nuclear missile silos. First

question: -- here, here, and here --
answer: -- which anyone knows takes more than a smile. Next

question: -- which we can't fake --
answer: -- and vocal confirmations from both the security center within the Bellagio and the vault below - -

question: -- which we won't get.
answer: Furthermore, the elevator shaft is rigged with motion detectors --

question: -- meaning if we manually override the lift, the shaft's exit will lock down automatically and we'll be trapped.
answer: Once we've gotten down the shaft, though, then it's a walk in the park

question: Well...
answer: Yeah...

question: Fourth task We need to build an exact, working replica of the Bellagio vault.
answer: For practice.

question: Something like that. Fifth task
answer: Benedict.

question: Learn to love his shadow. Sixth task
answer: Wait, wait, wait. All I get to do is watch him?

question: I'm sorry
answer: Oh, I understand perfectly. They are beautiful vans. Well, I thank you for your time, Mister...?

question: Denham. Billy Tim Denham.
answer: Yes, Denham, like a jean. You know

question: I'm sorry?
answer: I swear by it. I try all sorts of lotions. I went through a fragrance-free period last year, but now I'm liking this new brand fortified with rose hip. My sister, you know, she uses the aloe vera with the sun screen built in...

question: Uh-huh. You said you'd be willing to pay in cash?
answer: I did. You know

question: If you could pay cash, I could probably drop the price a little. To, say, seventeen... ... sixteen each.
answer: That would be lovely.

question: Get your wallet.
answer: This is nice material.

question: It's Armani, Saul.
answer: It's very nice.

question: Saul, you sure you're ready to do this?
answer: If you ever question me again, Daniel, you won't wake up the following morning.

question: You're ready.
answer: Hello. My name is Lyman Zerga... My name is Lyman Zerga... My name is Lyman Zerga... My name is Lyman Zerga...

question: There's a little over twenty grand there, Saul. Try to make it last.
answer: You seen my...

question: Okay. Tell me about Benedict.
answer: The guy is a machine. He arrives at the Bellagio every day at two p.m. Same Town Car, same driver. Remembers every valet's name on the way in. Not bad for a guy worth three-quarters of a billion. Offices are upstairs. He works hard, hits the lobby floor at seven on the nose. Spends three minutes on the floor with his casino manager.

question: What do they talk about?
answer: All business. Benedict likes to know what's going on in his casinos. There's rarely an incident he doesn't know about or handle personally. He spends a few minutes gladhanding the high rollers. He's fluent in Spanish, German and Italian, and he's taking Japanese lessons, getting pretty good at it. He's out by seven-thirty, when an assistant hands him a black portfolio. Contents Give him another ten seconds. As I said

question: And that portfolio contains the codes to all the cage doors?
answer: Two minutes after they've been changed, he's got 'em in hand. I'll tell you

question: -- his brother-in-law's tractor dealership, I heard.
answer: He doesn't just go after your knees, he goes after your livelihood. And everyone-you- ever-met's livelihood.

question: You scared?
answer: You suicidal?

question: Only in the morning. Now what?
answer: Now comes the girl... if she comes in after he does, that means they're in a snit.

question: Where's she come from?
answer: The museum downstairs. She's the curator there. Wait... here she is. You'll like this. I don't know if we can use her yet. I haven't even caught her name.

question: Tess.
answer: What?

question: 29:47. Everything okay in there?
answer: But what doesn't beat the shit out of being a circus performer?

question: What is it?
answer: Tell me this isn't about her. Or I'll walk off the job right now. Tess. She's with Terry Benedict now. Tell me this isn't about screwing the guy who's screwing your wife.

question: Ex-wife.
answer: Tell me.

question: It's not. About that. Entirely. You said you needed a reason. Well, this is mine. When we started in this business, we had three rules. We weren't gonna hurt anybody. We weren't gonna steal from anybody didn't have it coming. And we were gonna play the game like we had nothing to lose. Well, I lost something. Someone. That's why I'm here.
answer: Here's the problem

question: If things go to plan, I won't be the one who has to make that choice. How'd she look by the way? Tess...
answer: I've seen her happier.

question: 'Radiant' is the word. Absolutely radiant. He painted it in the summer of 1912, after the break-up with Fernande Olivier. You can see the conflict. He makes her both erotic and grotesque. He's hopelessly drawn to her, and yet she drives him crazy. Mr. Benedict is never late.
answer: Am I late?

question: Not at all, Mr. Benedict. Allow me to introduce to you Mr. Jean Santaniello.
answer: Mr. Santaniello, I apologize if I kept you. I had to iron out a few issues with my fight promoter. I gave him an unlimited budget, and he exceeded it. We hope.

question: Here it is.
answer: Magnificent! I've been following her for fifteen years now. At last I've made her a home. All the arrangements and so forth... Not mine. She belongs to everyone who comes into my hotel. Isn't that right, Ms. Ocean?

question: Yes, Mr. Benedict.
answer: She's lovely, isn't she? I can't be the only one who was after her. Ah, but this... You can't put a price on beauty. But I shouldn't philosophize. I own casinos, after all. Of course, of course.

question: You like it?
answer: I like that you like it. I have some bad news from the world of high fashion. It seems Mike Tyson will be wearing red on Saturday night. Red trunks with a white stripe.

question: Oh?
answer: And you, as I recall, will be wearing a red Donna Karan? And when the TV cameras pick us up in the front row, that red dress...

question: I see.
answer: He's a charming man, but no one's going to be watching him when they can make a study of you. I've asked Paolo to find three or four things for you to try. I hope you're not too disappointed. Are you sure? I'll see you tonight.

question: What? We're alone.
answer: In my hotels, there's always someone watching.

question: I'll see you tonight.
answer: Actually, I do like it.

question: Eddie. Anything for me?
answer: Mr. Zerga, sir. Lyman Zerga. In the third position. Wishes to speak with you privately.

question: Who is he?
answer: Businessman of some kind, working mostly in Europe. He's very vague, but I asked around. Word is he deals primarily in arms. One of the biggest.

question: Zerga? Never heard of him.
answer: Yessir. That's why I don't doubt it.

question: He's staying here?
answer: Checked in two nights ago, sir. He's in the Mirador suite.

question: How's he doing?
answer: Up. Almost forty grand.

question: You're thirty seconds late. I was about to send out a search party... Danny...
answer: Hello, Tess.

question: What are you doing here?
answer: I'm out.

question: You're out.
answer: Of prison. You remember. The day I went for cigarettes and never came back. You must have noticed.

question: I don't smoke. Don't sit --
answer: They said I'd paid my debt to society.

question: Funny, I never got a check.
answer: You're not wearing your ring.

question: I sold it. And I don't have a husband. Or didn't you get the papers?
answer: My last day inside.

question: I told you I'd write. Danny. Go. Now. Before...
answer: Benedict? Whiskey and -- -- whiskey.

question: Danny...
answer: You're doing a great job curating the museum. The Vermeer is quite good. Simple but vibrant. Although his work definitely fell off as he got older.

question: Remind you of anyone?
answer: And I still get Monet and Manet confused. Which one married his mistress?

question: Monet.
answer: Right. Manet had syphilis.

question: They also painted occasionally.
answer: You don't know how many times I played this conversation out in my head the last two years.

question: Did it always go this poorly?
answer: Yes.

question: Sounds frustrating.
answer: You were never easy. Okay. I'll make this quick. I came here for you. I'm gonna get on with my life, and I want you with me.

question: You're a thief and a liar.
answer: I only lied about being a thief. But I don't do that anymore.

question: Steal?
answer: Lie.

question: I'm with someone now who doesn't have to make that kind of distinction.
answer: No, he's very clear on both.

question: Nice. Work on that for two years, too?
answer: Year and a half.

question: Do you know what your problem is?
answer: I only have one?

question: You've met too many people like you. I'm with Terry now.
answer: Does he make you laugh?

question: Mr. Weintraub. How's everything? And here I thought you were drinking vodka. Mr. Zerga.
answer: Mr. Benedict. I recognize you from the TV. You know, nine casinos out of ten, owner comes up in the middle of the hand to ask me what I want. I respect your waiting.

question: You're the guest, sir.
answer: And I have to impose on your hospitality. Can you sit in for a hand?

question: I'd love to, Mr. Zerga, but the gaming board would feed me to my white tigers.
answer: That's a shame. You're the king of Vegas and you have to play craps in the alley.

question: No shame at all. Reminds me of my youth.
answer: The fight is Saturday, is it not?

question: Yes. I can get you seats...
answer: No, no. Hand-to-hand combat doesn't interest me. I have a package arriving here Saturday evening. A black briefcase, standard size, the contents of which are very valuable to me.

question: I'd be happy to put it in the house safe for you.
answer: The house safe is for brandy and grandmother's pearls. I'm afraid I need something more secure.

question: I can assure you, the house safe is utterly...
answer: I can assure you, Mr. Benedict, your generosity in this matter will not go overlooked. Now

question: See, the kind of people you steal things from, they have insurance to compensate them. They get made whole again. I had to leave New York to get away from what happened. How do I get my five years back, Danny?
answer: You can't. But what you can do is not throw away another five years.

question: You don't know anything about --
answer: Listen, you don't love me anymore, you want to make a life with someone else? Fine, I'll have to live with that. But not him.

question: Spoken like a true ex-husband.
answer: I'm not joking, Tess.

question: I'm not laughing. You have to admit there's a conflict of interest when you give me advice about my love life.
answer: Yes. But that doesn't mean I'm wrong.

question: Do you remember what I said to you when we first met?
answer: You said

question: Do you? Now? Because -- truly -- you should walk out the door if you don't.
answer: I know what I'm doing.

question: Is that right?
answer: I was shocked myself. Imagine the odds.

question: 'Of all the gin joints in all the world...' You've been in prison until recently, isn't that right? How does it feel to be out?
answer: About the same. Everything you want is still on the other side.

question: -- I can't.
answer: Well, then I don't imagine we'll be seeing you again, Mr. Ocean.

question: You never know.
answer: I know everything that happens in my hotels.

question: So I should put those towels back.
answer: The towels you can keep.

question: Blew the backup grid one by one! Like dominoes!
answer: Basher. What happened?

question: They did exactly what I planned to do. Only they did it by accident. Now they know their weakness. And they're fixing it.
answer: So...

question: About ten seconds.
answer: Could a pinch take out the power of an entire city? Like, I don't...

question: Las Vegas? But there's only one pinch in the world big enough to handle it.
answer: Where?

question: Pasadena.
answer: You two ready? What are you doing?

question: Are you a man?
answer: Yes. Nineteen.

question: Are you alive?
answer: Yes. Eighteen.

question: Evel Knievel.
answer: Shit! Okay, your turn...

question: Co-sign squared over .0455.
answer: No. Co-sign squared over .0415.

question: .04-five-five.
answer: One-five.

question: You're so wrong.
answer: You don't know your string theory, bitch.

question: Mom told me she loves me more.
answer: She told me she was going to tell you that. Stop it.

question: Make me.
answer: Stop it.

question: Saul
answer: It's time when I say it is.

question: Now!
answer: I'm out.

question: It's that or we shut down right now. His involvement puts us all at risk.
answer: This isn't your call.

question: You made it my call. When you put her ahead of us. You made it mine.
answer: This is my job.

question: Any sign of Ocean? Put a guy on him. He's here for a reason. I'd like to know what it is. But if he comes anywhere near Tess, take it to the next level.
answer: Mr. Benedict.

question: Mr. Zerga. It's a very busy night for me. Are we on schedule?
answer: I have no reason to suspect otherwise. My couriers should be here momentarily.

question: You new at the commission?
answer: Been there about two years.

question: I know Hal Lindley over there. You work with him at all?
answer: Not since he died last year.

question: Danny
answer: I'll just be a moment.

question: I'm having you thrown out of here. You're up to something, Danny. What? And don't say you came here for me. You're pulling a job, aren't you?
answer: Tess...

question: Well, know this
answer: I just came to say good-bye.

question: Oh... then... good-bye.
answer: Good-bye. Be good.

question: Good-bye, Danny.
answer: I thought he might.

question: Thank you for your cooperation, Mr. Escalante. Or should I call you Mr. Catton? You are Frank Catton? Formerly of the Tropicana, the Desert Inn and the New York State penitentiary system? Your silence suggests you don't refute that. Mr. Benedict, I'm afraid you've been employing an ex-convict. As you know, the N.G.C. strictly forbids...
answer: Goddamn cracker...

question: Pardon me.
answer: You heard me. Just 'cause a black man tries to earn a decent wage in this state...

question: That has nothing to do with...
answer: ... some cracker cowboy like you's gotta kick him out on the street. Want me to jump down, turn around, pick a bale of cotton, won't let me deal cards, might as well call it whitejack.

question: I resent your implication that race has anything to do with this. Now, as I was saying, the Nevada Gaming Commission strictly forbids the employment of the colored... ... I mean...
answer: Okay, okay, I'm cool.

question: Mr. Wills, if you don't mind... Mr. Wills?
answer: Of course. My beeper. I'm sorry. I forgot it.

question: You know how to get back out?
answer: Of course. Enjoy the fight.

question: Who do you like tonight?
answer: Huh?

question: Tyson or Lewis.
answer: The fight...? Lewis. You like Tyson? How strongly do you feel about it?

question: You looking for action?
answer: I'd go in for a buck.

question: Not yet. Okay.
answer: You think Yen made it out okay?

question: I'm sure he's fine.
answer: Jesus...

question: -- five, four, three --
answer: -- one --

question: What's wrong?
answer: I don't know.

question: What the hell is going on down there in the vault?
answer: Nothing, sir. All normal.

question: Show me.
answer: All quiet.

question: I'm afraid you're mistaken.
answer: You're watching your monitor? Okay, keep watching.

question: Jesus Christ...
answer: In this town, your luck can change just that quickly.

question: Alright. You've proved your point. You've broken into my vault. Congratulations
answer: Maybe.

question: May I ask Do you believe I'll simply allow you to parade bags full of my money out my casino doors?
answer: No. You're gonna carry it out for us.

question: And why would I do that?
answer: Take a closer look at your monitor... As your manager's probably reporting to you by now, you have a little over a hundred sixty million in your vault tonight. You may notice You let our eighty million go, and you get to keep your eighty. That's the deal. You try and stop us, we'll blow both cash loads. Mr. Benedict Hi.

question: You have a deal.
answer: It's alright, Tess. I promise. Good. Here's what you do. Five minutes from now, the men in the vault are going to deposit six bags in the vault elevator. If they meet anyone, we'll blow the money in the bags and the money in the vault. One minute after that, the elevator will rise to your cages. Six of your guards will pick up the bags and carry them out into the casino. If they take more than twenty seconds to reach the casino floor or if there's any indication a switch has been made, we'll blow the money in the vault and the money in the bags.

question: He's in the casino right now.
answer: Of course, I'm in the casino. In fact, I'm staying in your hotel. And I have two words for you ... a white unmarked van is going to pull up in your valet station. Your guards will load the bags into the van's rear. If anyone so much as approaches the driver's door, we blow everything.

question: Now what?
answer: Now, when I get word that the van hasn't been followed, that the money is secure, my men will exit the building, and once their safety is confirmed, you'll get your vault back.

question: Sir, I have complied with your every request, would you agree?
answer: I would.

question: Good. Now I have one of my own.
answer: Yes?

question: Do it.
answer: Cut it.

question: What's the situation down there?
answer: They blew it. They blew the... Oh, Jesus... If there was anyone in there, they're not in one piece anymore.

question: Tell them to take the van. I'm going down there. Find out how they fiddled with our cameras.
answer: Mr. Benedict...

question: Yes.
answer: We couldn't find any survivors. Or, I'm afraid, any of your money. I'm sorry, sir.

question: Take your men out now.
answer: Okay, guys, grab your gear and clear out.

question: Mr. Benedict...
answer: Yes?

question: They took the van.
answer: And?

question: And they blew up the bags, sir.
answer: Shit.

question: Sir... sir...
answer: What, Walsh?

question: They say it doesn't look like there was any money in the bags, sir.
answer: What?!

question: They say the bags were filled with fliers. For hookers.
answer: What do you mean there was no money in the bags?

question: That's what they said, sir. I don't understand it
answer: Walsh, cue up the tape of the robbery. Does it say 'Bellagio' on the south wall of the vault?

question: No, sir. It doesn't. I -- I don't understand...
answer: We had that installed on Tuesday. The image we saw of the men robbing us was a tape.

question: What?
answer: Someone built a double of my vault, then made a tape of them robbing it. When we saw them putting money in those bags, that wasn't actually happening.

question: Ocean... Where's Ocean? Open that door. Wake him up.
answer: Heya, Benedict... How's the other fight going?

question: Did you have a hand in this? Did you?
answer: Did I have a hand in what?

question: You get robbed or something, Benedict? Geez, that's a shame.
answer: Stop there. Where. Is. My. Money.

question: What would you say if I told you you could get your money back... ... if you gave up Tess? What would you say?
answer: I would say yes.

question: Well, that's very interesting... ... but I didn't have anything to do with it.
answer: Escort Mr. Ocean to the exit. And contact the police. I would imagine Mr. Ocean is in violation of his parole.

question: Three to six months, I should think.
answer: Looking for someone?

question: Thirteen million and you drive that piece of shit cross country to pick me up?
answer: Hello to you, too. Your hair's grayer.

question: Your eyes got closer together. How's life?
answer: Life... is a roomful of pillows. C'mon... Where do you want to go first?

question: To a phone.
answer: I stopped and picked up your personal effects, put them in the back seat.
